intro: Tubella tantilla, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically has hairy, narrow leaves and produces clusters of blue or purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Tubella tantilla plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
